intro: Berkheya echinacea, commonly known as the African echinacea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, hairy stems and produces yellow-orange composite flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Berkheya echinacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses in its native region.
